intro: Bladhia stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled bladhia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow sepals that give it its scientific name. The plant typically features showy, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or semi-shade environments.
